definition: number off! (command in military drill)/count off!
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: The teacher told the children to count off from right to left.
sentences.chinese: 教師叫孩子們自右向左報數。

sentences.english: What is more, it has the measurement voice output because of using new technique of speech process.
sentences.chinese: 引入語音處理新技術，實現測量結果語音報數。

sentences.english: None-Agricultural Population is from the Police Annals.
sentences.chinese: 非農業人口爲公安年報數。

sentences.english: The soldiers numbered off from the right.
sentences.chinese: 士兵們從右首開始報數。

sentences.english: The company was numbered off by the sergeant major.
sentences.chinese: 軍士長下令讓連隊報數。

sentences.english: The soldiers counted off from right to left.

definition: to change one's reservation/to transfer to a different flight, airline, bus or train
the only son of a family/(functional programming or philosophy) monad
to sign for the acceptance of sth (e.g. a delivery etc)
odd number (on a ticket, house etc)
remainder (after rounding a number)/decimal part (of number after the decimal point)/mantissa (i.e. fractional part of common logarithm in math.)/small change/balance (of an account)
to accept delivery of goods/to pick up goods
